sites.name: Catedral de Sevilla
sites.description: The Cathedral of Seville is the largest Gothic cathedral in the world and a UNESCO World Heritage site. Built on the site of a former mosque, it features the iconic Giralda bell tower, which was originally a minaret. The cathedral houses Christopher Columbus's tomb and numerous works of art, including paintings by Murillo and Goya. Its stunning architecture combines Gothic, Renaissance, and Baroque elements.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Summer brings intense heat, making early morning visits essential. Spring and autumn offer ideal temperatures. Winter provides fewer crowds. Special religious celebrations may affect access. The cathedral's interior provides relief from extreme weather.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended to avoid queues. Audio guides available in multiple languages. Guided tours offer deeper insights. Photography permitted in most areas. Combined tickets with Alcázar available. Free entry on Mondays 4:30-6 PM.

sites.name: Real Alcázar de Sevilla
sites.description: The Royal Alcázar of Seville is a stunning palace complex that combines Islamic and Christian architecture. Built over several centuries, it features beautiful gardens, intricate tilework, and ornate rooms. The palace is still used by the Spanish royal family as their official residence in Seville. The gardens are particularly noteworthy, with their fountains, pavilions, and exotic plants.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Summer heat makes early morning visits essential. Spring brings beautiful garden blooms. Autumn offers pleasant temperatures. Winter provides fewer crowds. Gardens are most spectacular in spring and early summer.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets strongly recommended. Guided tours available in multiple languages. Photography permitted in most areas. Comfortable walking shoes recommended. Combined tickets with Cathedral available. Free entry on Mondays 4-5 PM.

sites.name: Plaza de España
sites.description: Plaza de España is a magnificent square built for the 1929 Ibero-American Exposition. The semi-circular building features a canal with bridges representing Spain's provinces, and the square is decorated with beautiful tilework and fountains. The architecture combines Renaissance and Moorish Revival styles, creating a stunning backdrop for photos and leisurely walks.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Summer evenings bring relief from heat. Spring and autumn offer ideal temperatures. Winter provides fewer crowds. The square is particularly beautiful at sunset. Special events and performances throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Rowboat rentals available on the canal. Multiple entrances provide convenient access. Comfortable walking shoes recommended. Photography popular throughout the day. Located near Maria Luisa Park.

sites.name: Barrio de Santa Cruz
sites.description: The Santa Cruz neighborhood is Seville's historic Jewish quarter, featuring narrow winding streets, whitewashed buildings, and charming plazas. This picturesque area is filled with restaurants, tapas bars, and shops, offering a perfect blend of history and modern life. The neighborhood's intimate atmosphere and beautiful architecture make it a favorite among visitors.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Summer evenings bring outdoor dining and street performers. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures. Winter brings holiday decorations. The narrow streets provide shade during hot days. Special events and festivals throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Guided walking tours available. Comfortable walking shoes essential. Many restaurants and tapas bars to explore. Street performers common in good weather. Located near major attractions.

sites.name: Torre del Oro
sites.description: The Torre del Oro (Golden Tower) is a 13th-century military watchtower on the Guadalquivir River. Originally part of the city's defensive walls, it now houses a maritime museum. The tower's distinctive golden color and strategic location make it one of Seville's most recognizable landmarks.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Summer brings river cruises and increased visitors. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures. Winter provides fewer crowds. The tower's location by the river provides nice views year-round.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Small museum inside. Photography permitted. Combined tickets with river cruises available. Located near the river for easy access. Guided tours available.

sites.name: Parque de María Luisa
sites.description: Maria Luisa Park is Seville's most famous park, featuring beautiful gardens, fountains, and historic pavilions. Created for the 1929 Ibero-American Exposition, it offers a peaceful escape from the city's heat and bustle. The park includes the Plaza de América and various museums, making it both a recreational and cultural destination.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Spring brings blooming flowers and pleasant temperatures. Summer offers shade and relief from heat. Autumn features beautiful fall colors. Winter provides clear views and fewer crowds. Special events and performances throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Multiple entrances provide convenient access. Comfortable walking shoes recommended. Park maps available. Street performers and artists common in good weather. Located near Plaza de España.

sites.name: Museo de Bellas Artes
sites.description: The Museum of Fine Arts of Seville is one of Spain's most important art galleries, housed in a former convent. The collection focuses on Spanish Baroque art, particularly works by Murillo and Zurbarán. The building itself is a work of art, with its beautiful courtyards and architectural details.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with climate-controlled galleries. Less crowded on weekday mornings. Free entry for EU citizens. Special exhibitions rotate seasonally. Summer brings extended hours. The museum's central location makes it easily accessible in any weather.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Audio guides available. Guided tours offer deeper insights. Photography permitted in most areas. Museum café offers pleasant courtyard seating. Combined tickets with other museums available.

sites.name: Metropol Parasol
sites.description: Metropol Parasol, also known as 'Las Setas' (The Mushrooms), is a modern wooden structure in the heart of Seville. Built in 2011, it features a walkway with panoramic views of the city, an archaeological museum, and a market. The structure's unique design has made it a modern icon of Seville.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Evening views particularly spectacular. Summer brings longer hours and increased visitors. Winter offers clearer views but shorter hours. Spring and autumn provide ideal visiting conditions. The structure provides shade during hot days.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended for the walkway. Photography permitted. Comfortable walking shoes recommended. Archaeological museum located below. Market open during day. Located in central Seville.

sites.name: Triana
sites.description: Triana is a historic neighborhood across the Guadalquivir River, known for its traditional ceramics, flamenco culture, and vibrant atmosphere. The area features colorful streets, local markets, and authentic tapas bars. It's also famous for its traditional tile-making workshops and flamenco venues.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Summer evenings bring outdoor dining and street performers. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures. Winter brings holiday decorations. The neighborhood's riverside location provides nice views year-round.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Guided walking tours available. Comfortable walking shoes essential. Many restaurants and tapas bars to explore. Street performers common in good weather. Accessible by bridge from city center.

sites.name: Archivo de Indias
sites.description: The Archive of the Indies is a historic building housing documents relating to Spain's colonial history in the Americas. The building itself is a Renaissance masterpiece, and the archive contains millions of documents, including maps, letters, and official records from the colonial period.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with climate-controlled reading rooms. Less crowded on weekday mornings. Special exhibitions rotate seasonally. Summer brings extended hours. The building's central location makes it easily accessible in any weather.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Guided tours available. Photography permitted in designated areas. Research access requires advance registration. Located near the Cathedral.

sites.name: Plaza de Toros de la Maestranza
sites.description: The Maestranza Bullring is one of Spain's most historic and beautiful bullrings. Built in the 18th century, it features a distinctive Baroque facade and houses a museum about bullfighting history. The bullring is still active during the bullfighting season.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round for tours. Bullfighting season runs March-October. Summer brings peak tourist crowds. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures. Winter provides fewer visitors. Special events may affect access.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended for tours. Photography permitted in museum. Guided tours available. Check schedule for bullfighting events. Located near the river.

sites.name: Museo del Baile Flamenco
sites.description: The Flamenco Dance Museum offers an interactive experience about flamenco culture and history. The museum features exhibits about flamenco's origins, costumes, and instruments, and hosts live performances in its intimate theater.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Evening performances most popular. Summer brings increased visitors. Winter offers fewer crowds. Special performances throughout the year. The museum's central location makes it easily accessible.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended for performances. Photography permitted in most areas. Guided tours available. Check schedule for live shows. Located in historic building.

sites.name: Isla Mágica
sites.description: Isla Mágica is a theme park themed around Spain's Age of Discovery. Located on the site of the 1992 World Expo, it features rides, shows, and attractions based on historical themes. The park combines entertainment with educational elements about Spain's colonial history.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open March-December. Summer brings peak crowds and heat. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures. Winter provides fewer visitors. Special events and shows throughout the season.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended. Check opening hours by season. Some attractions may close in bad weather. Located outside city center. Multiple transportation options available.

sites.name: Palacio de las Dueñas
sites.description: The Palace of the Dukes of Alba is a beautiful 15th-century palace featuring Mudéjar architecture, gardens, and art collections. The palace combines Gothic, Renaissance, and Islamic architectural elements, creating a unique historical experience.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Summer heat makes early morning visits essential. Spring brings beautiful garden blooms. Autumn offers pleasant temperatures. Winter provides fewer crowds. Gardens are most spectacular in spring.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended. Guided tours available. Photography permitted in most areas. Comfortable walking shoes recommended. Located in historic district.

sites.name: Museo Arqueológico
sites.description: The Archaeological Museum of Seville houses artifacts from prehistoric times to the modern era, with a special focus on Roman and Islamic periods. The museum is located in a beautiful neoclassical building in Maria Luisa Park.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with climate-controlled galleries. Less crowded on weekday mornings. Free entry for EU citizens. Special exhibitions rotate seasonally. Summer brings extended hours.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Audio guides available. Guided tours offer deeper insights. Photography permitted in most areas. Located in Maria Luisa Park.

sites.name: Parque del Alamillo
sites.description: Alamillo Park is a large urban park offering extensive green spaces, walking trails, and recreational activities. The park features a lake, sports facilities, and areas for picnics, making it a popular destination for locals and visitors seeking outdoor activities.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Summer mornings and evenings most pleasant. Spring and autumn offer ideal temperatures. Winter provides fewer crowds. The park's size makes it suitable for various activities in any season.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Multiple entrances available. Comfortable walking shoes recommended. Sports equipment rentals available. Located outside city center.
